What does the `getvdxfid` command do in Verus, and what is the format of the result?

The `getvdxfid` command in Verus processes a given string with the VDXF (Verus Data eXchange Format) and returns an object with both base58check and hex vdxfid values of the string and its parents. The result is a JSON object containing the following properties:

* `vdxfid`: The base58check i-ID of the URI processed with the VDXF and all combined parameters.
* `hash160result`: A 20-byte hash in hex of the URL string passed in, processed with the VDXF.
* `qualifiedname`: An object with separate name and parent ID values.
* `bounddata`: An object containing additional data bound to create the value, if applicable.

#### Result:
```json
{                   (object) object with both base58check and hex vdxfid values of string and parents
 "vdxfid"               (base58check) i-ID of the URI processed with the VDXF & all combined parameters
 "hash160result"           (hexstring) 20 byte hash in hex of the URL string passed in, processed with the VDXF
 "qualifiedname":           (object) separate name and parent ID value
 {
  "name": "namestr"         (string) leaf name
  "parentid" | "namespace":"string" (string) parent ID (or namespace if VDXF key) of name
 }
 "bounddata": {            (object) if additional data is bound to create the value, it is returned here {
  "vdxfkey":"i-address or vdxfkey"  (string) i-address that was combined via hash
  "uint256":"32bytehex"       (hexstr) 256 bit hash combined with hash
  "indexnum":int           (integer) int32_t combined with hash
 }
}```
Examples:
```bash
Create the signature
> verus getvdxfid "system.currency.export"Verify the signature
> verus getvdxfid "idname::userdefinedgroup.subgroup.publishedname"As json rpc
> curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "getvdxfid", "params": ["idname::userdefinedgroup.subgroup.publishedname"] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/
```## Wallet### `addmultisigaddress nrequired ["key",...] ( "account" )`
Add a nrequired-to-sign multisignature address to the wallet.
Each key is a VRSC address or hex-encoded public key.
If 'account' is specified (DEPRECATED), assign address to that account.
How can I use the `getvdxfid` command in Verus to create and verify a signature?

You can use the `getvdxfid` command in Verus to create and verify a signature by passing a string to the command. For example, to create a signature, you can run `verus getvdxfid "system.currency.export"`. To verify the signature, you can run `verus getvdxfid "idname::userdefinedgroup.subgroup.publishedname"`. You can also use JSON RPC to call the `getvdxfid` method, as shown in the example using `curl`.

#### Result:

  "parentid" | "namespace":"string" (string) parent ID (or namespace if VDXF key) of name
 }

  "indexnum":int           (integer) int32_t combined with hash
 }
}```

```## Wallet### `addmultisigaddress nrequired ["key",...] ( "account" )`
Add a nrequired-to-sign multisignature address to the wallet.
Each key is a VRSC address or hex-encoded public key.
If 'account' is specified (DEPRECATED), assign address to that account.
What is the purpose of the `addmultisigaddress` command in Verus, and how do I use it?

The `addmultisigaddress` command in Verus is used to add a nrequired-to-sign multisignature address to the wallet. The command takes three parameters: `nrequired`, a list of keys, and an optional account name. Each key is a VRSC address or hex-encoded public key. You can use this command to create a multisignature address that requires a certain number of signatures to spend funds. For example, `addmultisigaddress 2 ["key1", "key2", "key3"]` would create a multisignature address that requires 2 out of 3 signatures to spend funds.

#### Result:
```json
{                   (object) object with both base58check and hex vdxfid values of string and parents

 "qualifiedname":           (object) separate name and parent ID value
 {
  "name": "namestr"         (string) leaf name
  "parentid" | "namespace":"string" (string) parent ID (or namespace if VDXF key) of name
 }
 "bounddata": {            (object) if additional data is bound to create the value, it is returned here {

  "uint256":"32bytehex"       (hexstr) 256 bit hash combined with hash
  "indexnum":int           (integer) int32_t combined with hash
 }
}```
